results.title: Drawings and the shop
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Emphasises and describes the relationship between the making of the drawing and the various production operations in shop and factory. The flow of work, as called for in the various drawings of typical metal products, is traced through the pattern shop, the foundry, the forge shop, the machine shop, and the assembly shop. Representative operations in each of these departments is demonstrated.

results.title: Auxiliary views: double auxiliaries
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Begins with a quick view of orthographic projection on three principal planes and on auxiliary planes; then points out that a new condition is introduced if the object to be drawn has a slanting face that is not perpendicular to any of the principal planes. The film shows why a single auxiliary view does not give an accurate picture of an oblique face. The theory of double auxiliary or oblique view is then described in detail, using the visualization effects of combined animated drawings and animated models.

results.title: Accent on learning
results.creator_credit: Robert W Wagner and Department of Photography, Ohio State University
results.brief_description: This film explores the meaning of teaching and suggests creative methods for use by teachers. Samples of teaching methods are shown: lecturers who communicate with words, with the assistance of the blackboard, with slide projectors etc. Success in teaching rests upon organisation of material in a meaningful way. Suggested materials are charts, films, film strips, lantern slides, tape recorders.

results.title: Accent on adventure
results.brief_description: Outdoor sports for boy scouts have been and continue to be a basic part of scouting. They require both nerve and skill. This is a report on some of them; including boating, potholing, rock climbing, hill walking, riding, skiing and motor cycling. A film depicting British scouting activities at their best.

results.title: Abstract in concrete (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Arvonio and John Arvonio Productions
results.brief_description: An experimental film produced by photographing neon signs in the wet pavements of Times Square New York. This unusual film was painstakingly photographed on rainy nights, under difficult conditions, over a period of five years. The producer has discovered, and recorded, a wealth of visual beauty in the patterns and movements of the constantly changing light reflections.

results.title: Abraham Lincoln. - 2nd edition.
results.creator_credit: Kathy Tallon, Scott Craig and Scott Craig Productions
results.brief_description: Beginning with the statement that Lincoln became the “last victim of the Civil War”, when he was assassinated, the film traces his life from humble beginnings in a log cabin, an axe wielding woodsman and also voracious reader as a youth, to candidate to the State Assembly at twenty-three in 1832. However, the film gives no hint of criticism of Lincoln, who spoke “with courage and conviction for all people”, and no analysis of the causes of events or action is attempted.

results.title: About time
results.creator_credit: Ed De Martin, Robert Marona and De Martin - Marona
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a girl and a tree she discovered as a child. Compares this relationship and the paradox of modern man caught in the time squeeze in order to point out the need for man to reorder his values concerning planet Earth.

results.title: About the human body
results.brief_description: A young boy who goes to a doctor’s office for a physical examination is told about the more important body systems. Explains, using animation, the functions and uses of bones, ligaments and muscles, and demonstrates the working of the nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems.

results.title: Abortion: a tale of two cities
results.brief_description: Uses two dramatised case studies to highlight some of the problems faced by different sections of the community, in the provision of abortion. Intended for women’s groups and for people concerned with health education. Cast includes: Judy Snape, Marlene Sidaway, Max Smith, Derry Jordan, Fred Grant. Narrated by Peter Ellis.
